---
slug: /207
title: "This Week In React #207: Next.js, use cache, shadcn/ui, Headless UI, RN 0.76, New Architecture, NativeWind, Expo 52, Edge-to-Edge, RNTL, Reassure, Bottom Tabs, Flutter, Node.js..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 10-30-2024
---
Hi everyone!
This is another great React week.
Vercel has unveiled new super-interesting caching APIs for Next.js, and the React Native ecosystem is on fire!

segments.source_content: On my side, I'm a bit tired of Twitter penalizing me for commenting external links. I'm giving Bluesky a try ([@sebastienlorber.com](https://bsky.app/profile/sebastienlorber.com)). Come say hi if you are there.
Don't forget to fill in the [State of React survey](https://survey.devographics.com/en-US/survey/state-of-react/2024?source=this_week_in_react), and mention that you read the newsletter ğŸ˜‡.

## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![Next.js Conf 2024 Recap](/emails/issues/207/nextjsconf.jpg)](https://vercel.com/blog/recap-next-js-conf-2024)
[**Next.js Conf 2024 Recap**](https://vercel.com/blog/recap-next-js-conf-2024)
Last week, the community gathered at the Next.js conference. This recap is a nice overview of the highlights, including:

- Next.js 15 stable
- Turbopack Dev stable
- Simpler caching, reduced complexity
- Self-hosting improvements and templates

segments.source_content: The sister blog post [Our Journey with Caching](https://nextjs.org/blog/our-journey-with-caching) is particularly interesting, introducing new experimental caching semantics and APIs such as `use cache`, `cacheTag`, and `cacheLife`. Itâ€™s a more flexible system, and super cool that you donâ€™t even need to provide a cache key.

segments.source_content: ## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}
[![New Architecture by default, DevTools, and more](/emails/issues/207/newarch.jpg)](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)
[**React Native 0.76 \- New Architecture by default, DevTools, and more**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)

React Native 0.76 is out with major updates\! The New Architecture is now enabled by default, there's a new React Native DevTools for improved debugging, and CSS support for `boxShadow` and `filter` for enhanced UI effects (available only with the new architecture). Be aware of some breaking changes: minimum SDK requirements have been raised to iOS 15.1 and Android SDK 24 (Android 7). Time to upgrade and check it out\!

translations.zh-hant: React Native 0.76 ç™¼å¸ƒé‡å¤§æ›´æ–°ï¼æ–°æ¶æ§‹ç¾å·²é è¨­å•Ÿç”¨ï¼Œæ–°å¢ React Native DevTools å¼·åŒ–é™¤éŒ¯èƒ½åŠ›ï¼Œä¸¦æ”¯æ´ CSS çš„ `boxShadow` å’Œ `filter` å±¬æ€§ä»¥æå‡ UI æ•ˆæœï¼ˆåƒ…æ–°æ¶æ§‹å¯ç”¨ï¼‰ã€‚è«‹æ³¨æ„ç ´å£æ€§è®Šæ›´ï¼šæœ€ä½ SDK éœ€æ±‚å·²æé«˜è‡³ iOS 15.1 å’Œ Android SDK 24ï¼ˆAndroid 7ï¼‰ã€‚ç«‹å³å‡ç´šé«”é©—ï¼

segments.source_content: v0.76 is cool, but whatâ€™s even better is that the [New Architecture is here](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/the-new-architecture-is-here) and officially declared ready to be used in production\! This is a multi-year effort and a huge milestone for the React Native ecosystem\! At this point, you probably already heard about JSI, Fabric, Turbomodules, synchronous low-overhead bridgeless communication, interop mode, and more. Itâ€™s not just about performance, but also solving important UX/DX problems such as being able to measure views synchronously to position a tooltip, or having `useLayoutEffect` work like on the web. What excites me most is also probably the most underrated: React Native can finally use React 18+ concurrent features, notably transitions, Suspense, and whatâ€™s coming next.

translations.zh-hant: v0.76 é›–é…·ï¼Œä½†æ›´æ£’çš„æ˜¯[æ–°æ¶æ§‹å·²æ­£å¼å®£å‘Š](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/the-new-architecture-is-here)å¯æŠ•å…¥ç”Ÿç”¢ç’°å¢ƒï¼é€™æ˜¯æ­·ç¶“å¤šå¹´çš„é‡å¤§é‡Œç¨‹ç¢‘ï¼æ‚¨å¯èƒ½å·²è½è JSIã€Fabricã€Turbomodulesã€åŒæ­¥ä½é–‹éŠ·ç„¡æ©‹æ¥é€šè¨Šã€äº’æ“ä½œæ¨¡å¼ç­‰æŠ€è¡“ã€‚é€™ä¸åƒ…é—œä¹æ•ˆèƒ½ï¼Œæ›´è§£æ±ºäº†è«¸å¦‚åŒæ­¥æ¸¬é‡è¦–åœ–å®šä½å·¥å…·æç¤ºã€è®“ `useLayoutEffect` å¦‚ç¶²é èˆ¬é‹ä½œç­‰ UX/DX ç—›é»ã€‚æœ€ä»¤äººæŒ¯å¥®å»è¢«ä½ä¼°çš„æ˜¯ï¼šReact Native çµ‚æ–¼èƒ½å®Œæ•´é‹ç”¨ React 18+ çš„ä¸¦è¡ŒåŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œç‰¹åˆ¥æ˜¯éæ¸¡æ•ˆæœã€Suspense åŠæœªä¾†æ–°ç‰¹æ€§ã€‚

SafeAreaView is going to be deprecated. The new library [react-native-edge-to-edge](https://github.com/zoontek/react-native-edge-to-edge) is an alternative to fully embrace edge-to-edge rendering. Note it just reached 1.0 and is supported by Expo.
